metadata.title: CVE-2021-47509 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:pcm: oss: Limit the period size to 16MB Set the practical limit to theperiod size (the fragment shift in OSS) instead of a full 31bit; a toolarge value could lead to the exhaust of memory as we allocate temporarybuffers of the period size, too. As of this patch, we set to 16MB limit,which should cover all use cases.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
